refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mosquitto.conf is the configuration file for mosquitto. The system wide file /etc/mosquitto.conf is the default configuration. If this is not found, mosquitto will attempt to open a configuration file in the current directory.

refsect1.title: File Format
refsect1.para: All lines with a # as the very first character are treated as a comment.
Configuration lines start with a variable name. The variable value is separated from the name by a single space.

listitem.para: Set the network port to listen on. Defaults to 1883.

Can be 1 or 0, denoting true or false. If true, connection, subscription and message data will be written to the disk in mosquitto.db at the location dictated by persistence_location. If false, the data will be stored in memory only.
The path where the persistence database should be stored. Must end in a trailing slash. If not given, then the current directory is used.
Write a pid file to the file specified. If not given (the default), no pid file will be written. If the pid file cannot be written, mosquitto will exit.
The integer number of seconds after a message has been sent before retrying when no response is received. If unset, defaults to 10 seconds.
The integer number of seconds between updates of the $SYS subscription hierarchy, which provides status information about the broker. If unset, defaults to 10 seconds.

refsect1.title: Bugs
refsect1.para: mosquitto bug information can be found at http://launchpad.net/mosquitto.
